controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
      • controller.Controller

  • public abstract class Controller
extends javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
    Controller is the abstract class responsible for the game loop and handling input. setView and setModel should return the model and view that are too be associated with this controller.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Model model 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Controller()
      Calls the extended methods in order to initiate the Controller.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle(long now)
      Calls Controller tick then gets input and calls handleInput on it, then calls the Model tick and finally renders to the current View.
      protected void nextController(Controller newController)
      Stops current game loop and passes the input handler down to the next Controller, then starts it.
      void setGraphicsContext(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double h, double w)
      Used for setting a new controller.
      void setInputHandler(InputHandler ih)
      Used for setting a new controller.
      protected abstract Model setModel()
      Should return Model to be associated with this controller.
      protected abstract View setView()
      Should return View to be associated with this controller.
      protected abstract void tick(java.util.List<java.lang.String> input)
      Should call methods in the Model to handle the input and hold the logic to determine if there is a controller change, do nothing to continue with the same controller, to switch controllers instantiate the next controller and pass it to nextController().

      • Methods inherited from class javafx.animation.AnimationTimer

        start, stop

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setView

        protected abstract View setView()
        Should return View to be associated with this controller.
        Returns:
        View to be associated with this controller.

      • setModel

        protected abstract Model setModel()
        Should return Model to be associated with this controller.
        Returns:
        Model to be associated with this controller.

      • tick

        protected abstract void tick(java.util.List<java.lang.String> input)
        Should call methods in the Model to handle the input and hold the logic to determine if there is a controller change, do nothing to continue with the same controller, to switch controllers instantiate the next controller and pass it to nextController().
        Parameters:
        input - holds all of the keys pressed for this frame like "LEFT".

      • handle

        public void handle(long now)
        Calls Controller tick then gets input and calls handleInput on it, then calls the Model tick and finally renders to the current View.
        Specified by:
        handle in class javafx.animation.AnimationTimer
        Parameters:
        now - current time for position extrapolation.

      • nextController

        protected void nextController(Controller newController)
        Stops current game loop and passes the input handler down to the next Controller, then starts it.
        Parameters:
        newController - the controller to switch to

      • setInputHandler

        public void setInputHandler(InputHandler ih)
        Used for setting a new controller.
        Parameters:
        ih - current InputHandler

      • setGraphicsContext

        public void setGraphicsContext(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                               double h,
                               double w)
        Used for setting a new controller.
        Parameters:
        gc - current GraphicsContext
        h - height of GraphicsContext
        w - width of GraphicsContext
